trans-unit.source: Represents a security token provider that provides <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref> security tokens for a SOAP message sender.

In most instances it is not necessary to call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider> class directly, as it is called when a client sends a SOAP message that requires a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token.

Specifically, a client specifies the type of security token required, using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method to get a security token.

When the security token required is an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider"></xref> class using the specified X.509 certificate.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method gets a security token based on the certificate specified in the `certificate` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> to get a security token for.
certificate is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider"></xref> class by getting an X.509 certificate from the specified certificate store criteria.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method gets a security token based on the certificate that matches the specified certificate store criteria.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreLocation"></xref> values that specifies the certificate store location.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.StoreName"></xref> values that specifies the certificate store name.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509FindType"></xref> values that specifies how to search the certificate store.
The value used to find the X.509 certificate in the certificate store.
findValue is `null`.
No certificates match the specified criteria.
-or-
More than one certificate matches the specified criteria.
Gets the X.509 certificate associated with the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref> security token.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method gets a security token based on the certificate represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.Certificate%2A> property.
Gets an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that represents the X.509 certificate of a security token.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider"></xref>.
Gets a security token using the X.509 certificate specified in the constructor.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class when a client sends a SOAP message and an <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token is required.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509SecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that specifies the timeout value for the message that gets the security token.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the security token to get.
